page.title: 08BY BALLINDALLOCH WATERS
page.content: On the banks of a stream a moorhen leads her black,fluffy chicks into the water while a coot wanders among the reeds. Mallard ducks take off with beating wings towards the river.There at the edge of the water a heron stands motionless, his long beak ready to plunge on an unlucky fish.A flock of oyster-catchers probe among the stones but some fly overhead bleeping their shrill alarm-calls. Lapwings wheel and dive above the haughs and a wagtail flits over the water from stone to stone. On the heather-covered hills above, red grouse utter their "Go back, go back" call.Foxes,stoats,weasels and perhaps even wild cats go about the business of seeking food. In the distance a curlew gives its long, bubbling cry.
